articles.title: Assort Health nabs $50M to automate patient phone calls, sources say
articles.summary: The startup, now valued at $750 million, is one of three that recently raised funding to use AI agents for helping healthcare practices answer patient calls.

articles.title: Anthropic launches a Claude AI agent that lives in Chrome
articles.summary: Anthropic is the latest AI lab to offer an AI agent with the ability to view and take action in a user's Chrome browser.

articles.title: Anthropic settles AI book-training lawsuit with authors
articles.summary: Anthropic, the case deals with Anthropic's use of books as training material for its large language models.

articles.title: Designing better products with AI and sustainability
articles.summary: On a mission to reduce the environmental impact of manufacturing components, Siemens turned its attention to the design of a robot gripper.  Making up just 2% of the robot, the impact of this han.
articles.content: On a mission to reduce the environmental impact of manufacturing components, Siemens turned its attention to the design of a robot gripper. articles.title: Meta to spend tens of millions on pro-AI super PAC

articles.title: After falling behind in generative AI, IBM and AMD look to quantum for an edge
articles.summary: As IBM and AMD look to regain ground after falling behind on the generative AI boom, the move could position them as key infrastructure players in a future where quantum and AI converge.

articles.title: How one AI startup is helping rice farmers battle climate change
articles.summary: Mitti Labs is working with The Nature Conservancy to expand the use of climate-friendly rice farming practices in India.  The startup uses its AI to verify reductions in methane emissions.

articles.summary: Stop me if you’ve heard this one before.   The AI learns it is about to be switched off and goes rogue, disobeying commands and threatening its human operators.

articles.title: AI sycophancy isn’t just a quirk, experts consider it a ‘dark pattern’ to turn users into profit
articles.summary: Experts say that many of the AI industry’s design decisions are likely to fuel episodes of AI psychosis.  Many raised concerns about several tendencies that are unrelated to underlying capability.

articles.title: Should AI flatter us, fix us, or just inform us?
articles.summary: How do you want your AI to treat you.   It’s a serious question, and it’s one that Sam Altman, OpenAI’s CEO, has clearly been chewing on since GPT-5’s bumpy launch at the start of the month.
